title: The Dow Rose 115 Points Because the Fed’s Third Rate Cut Is the Charm
text: Third Strike. After trading largely below break-even throughout the day, all three major stock indexes closed in the black as investors were encouraged by the Federal Reserve’s third rate cut of the year, announced in the afternoon. The central bank lowered interest rates by 0.25 percentage point, but signaled it will pause to assess the economy before acting again. The U.S. economy continued to grow at a healthy pace in the third quarter lifted by strong consumer spending, although business investment and exports remained weak. The APEC summit was canceled, but U.S.-China trade talks remained on. In today’s After the...
description: After trading largely below break-even throughout the day, all three major stock indexes closed in the black as investors were encouraged by the Federal Reserve’s third rate cut of the year, announced in the afternoon.
